oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Real photo postcard of Murray Austin in uniform sent to Vealy Austin
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Pvt. Murray L. Austin of Scotts Hill, Tennessee was an ambulance driver in Transport Co. 306 for a field hospital in France during the war. The left arm of his uniform bears a Red Cross armband. He moved to Lexington after the war and became a postman. His brother, Pvt. Perry Austin served as a driver in Motor Truck Co. 536 and this postcard was sent to his wife, Vealy Austin in Finley, Tennessee. [See also GWjack001-GWjack010.]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Austin, Murray L.
World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
